title: Blink-182 Announce Spring U.S. Tour
text:
Blink-182 will take their new LP California on the road this spring with an 18-date trek that focuses on the lower half of the continental United States. Related Mark Hoppus Denies Meeting With Tom DeLonge "That is something so far down the road to even be a possibility," bassist says 
The jaunt launches March 22nd in Austin, Texas and storms venues in the southern states, culminating May 9th in New Orleans, Louisiana. 
Along the way, the band – now Mark Hoppus, Travis Barker and Alkaline Trio's Matt Skiba – will perform at Houston's NRG Stadium, home of Super Bowl 51 as well as Dallas' KDGE Edgefest and Tucson, Arizona's KMFA Day. 
Wavves and the Naked and Famous accompany the band on select dates. 
Following the U.S. tour, the trio will head overseas for a month-long Europe tour. Check out Blink-182's site for full ticket information. 
Blink-182 released California , their first LP in five years and first album with Skiba since Tom DeLonge's rancorous split from the band, in July; the band have promised to release a deluxe edition of the album in 2017. 
Blink-182 Tour Dates 
March 22 - Austin, TX @ Austin 360 AmphitheaterMarch 23 - Houston, TX @ NRG StadiumMarch 25 - Las Cruces, NM @ New Mexico StateMarch 26 - Tucson, AZ @ KFMA DayMarch 28 - Lubbock, TX @ Lonestar AmphitheaterMarch 30 - Kansas City, MO @ Silverstein AmphitheaterApril 1 - Dallas, TX @ KDGE EdgefestApril 19 - Flagstaff, AZ @ Northern Arizona UniversityApril 21 - Amarillo, TX @ Aztec Music HallApril 22 - Rogers, AR @ Wal-Mart AmphitheaterApril 23 - Springfield, MO @ Shrine MosqueApril 25 - Pelham, AL @ Oak Mountain AmphitheaterApril 26 - Charleston, SC @ N. Charleston ColiseumApril 27 - Knoxville, TN @ Civic ColiseumMay 2 - Pensacola, FL @ Pensacola Bay CenterMay 3 - Tallahassee, FL @ The PavilionMay 4 - Orlando, FL @ Orlando FairgroundsMay 9 - New Orleans, LA @ UNO Lakefront Arena More News
